message: Then you get most of the benefits of Native while still having most of the app UI in html5
Redfin talk on HTML5 vs Native apps for Mobile - https://docs.google.com/present/view?id=0ARVpkVHr1HpsZGd6cThnNzhfMTFuMmdnemZnag&hl=en
Question is - why not just wrap html5 in a native shell with safari browser?
Have you checked out phonegap? Worth reviewing in this context.
If you could wrap it so it has offline access through some type of persistance that would be a good start.
too bad most chrome webapp is just a bookmark link...
@zitterbewegung it's actually the main idea for phonegap and to some extent, chrome webapp (when done right)

This might interest you guys. Purplecabbage, one of the devs working on phonegap, released a beta of Cleavage on github which seems to allow embedding phonegap into a native app. https://github.com/purplecabbage/cleavage
@sleeperbot I believe that Appcelerator apps are written in Javascript but they get translated into native code.
Code translation is pretty unreasonable if maintained by a company. There is no way one company could (really) keep up with all the changes in different mobile sdk's. HTML5 should be the goal.
@unwrangle I might do that with my app
I've build several apps with PhoneGap, it works really well, and using HTML5's localStorage you can persist data even offline.
